Package moulton.scalable.geometrics

Class PolygonalButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • moulton.scalable.utils.MenuComponent
      • moulton.scalable.clickables.Clickable
        • moulton.scalable.clickables.RadioButton
          • moulton.scalable.geometrics.PolygonalButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TouchResponsiveComponent
    public class PolygonalButton
extends RadioButton
    A menu component button in the shape of a polygon as opposed to a rectangle
    Author:
    Matthew Moulton

    • Field Detail

      • xs

        protected java.lang.String[] xs
        Expressions that determine the shape of the button. Should be written in a way that can be solved by MenuComponent.solveString(String, int, int) at runtime.

      • ys

        protected java.lang.String[] ys
        Expressions that determine the shape of the button. Should be written in a way that can be solved by MenuComponent.solveString(String, int, int) at runtime.

      • numberOfPoints

        protected int numberOfPoints
        Internal variable for the number of points in the shape. Results to the minimum length of xs and ys.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PolygonalButton

        public PolygonalButton​(java.lang.String id,
                       Panel parent,
                       java.lang.String[] xs,
                       java.lang.String[] ys,
                       java.awt.Color color)
        Creates a new button in the shape of a polygon with arbitrary point number.
        Parameters:
        id - a unique string designed to identify this component when an event occurs
        parent - the parent panel for this component.
        xs - the string expressions dictating the points on the parent panel that define this component.
        ys - the string expressions dictating the points on the parent panel that define this component.
        color - the color of the button when not pressed. By default, the pressed color will be one shade darker and the uneditable color will be one shade lighter.

      • PolygonalButton

        public PolygonalButton​(java.lang.String id,
                       Panel parent,
                       int x,
                       int y,
                       java.lang.String[] xs,
                       java.lang.String[] ys,
                       java.awt.Color color)
        Creates a new button in the shape of a polygon with arbitrary point number.
        Parameters:
        id - a unique string designed to identify this component when an event occurs
        parent - the parent panel for this component.
        x - the integer x coordinate this button should appear on its panel
        y - the integer y coordinate this button should appear on its panel
        xs - the string expressions dictating the points on the parent panel that define this component.
        ys - the string expressions dictating the points on the parent panel that define this component.
        color - the color of the button when not pressed. By default, the pressed color will be one shade darker and the uneditable color will be one shade lighter.

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g,
                   int xx,
                   int yy,
                   int ww,
                   int hh)
        Description copied from class: MenuComponent
        Draws on the graphics object to represent this component visually. When this method is called, the type of panel storing (grid or free) has been taken into account and the dimensions of the space given to this component have been calculated using MenuComponent.solveString(String, int, int).
        Specified by:
        render in class MenuComponent
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics object to draw on
        xx - the x-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
        yy - the y-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
        ww - the width on the graphics image that this component is given
        hh - the height on the graphics image this component is given

      • setTouched

        public void setTouched​(boolean touched)
        Sets whether this button is touched. Also updates Clickable.outline.
        Specified by:
        setTouched in interface TouchResponsiveComponent
        Overrides:
        setTouched in class Clickable
        Parameters:
        touched - whether the component is touched by the mouse: Clickable.touched.

      • setTouchedColor

        public void setTouchedColor​(java.awt.Color touchedColor)
        If touchedColor is null, then the toggle outline effect will be used instead
        Parameters:
        touchedColor - the color to set as RadioButton.colorTouched
